Class Stat

java.lang.Object
  SystemCall
      Stat

public class Stat
extends SystemCall

Get file system information about a node in the filesystem.
TODO

  • Be able to set permissions, dates, etc.
  • Document
  • Look into handling: st_dev, st_ino, st_mode, st_nlink, st_uid, st_gid, st_rdev, st_blksize, st_blocks
/usr/bin/chflags /bin/chmod 0

Constructor Detail

Stat

public Stat(File f)
Create a Stat for the given file.

Parameters:
f - The file to stat.
Method Detail

available

public static boolean available(int check)
Determines if this version of Java and this Operating System support checking a specified field.

Parameters:
check - One of the constants in this class. NOTE: IsFile and IsHidden have the same value, but IsHidden will always be used. IsFile is always true, so you shouldn't check that.
Returns:
true if you can check that field without causing an UnsupportedOperationException

readable

public boolean readable()
Determines if the file is readable.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if User, Group or Other can read, otherwise the File method canRead is used
See Also:
File.canRead()

writable

public boolean writable()
Determines if the file is writeable.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if User, Group or Other can write and not locked, otherwise the File method canWrite is used
See Also:
File.canWrite()

hidden

public boolean hidden()
Determines if the file is hidden.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if User, Group or Other can write, otherwise the File method canWrite is used
See Also:
File.isHidden()

executable

public boolean executable()
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException
Determines if the file is executable.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if User, Group or Other can execute. If Java 1.6 or later the File method canExecute is used. otherwise UnsupportedOperationException is thrown
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if this Operating System/Java version cannot determine if the file is executable

backup

public boolean backup()
Determines if the file is available for backup.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if the file is not marked for backup exclusion. otherwise true is returned.

file

public boolean file()
Determines if the item is a file.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if the path represents a file, otherwise the File method isFile is used
See Also:
File.isFile()

directory

public boolean directory()
Determines if the item is a directory.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if the path represents a directory, otherwise the File method isDirectory is used
See Also:
File.isDirectory()

link

public boolean link()
Determines if the item is a link.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns true if the path represents a symlink, otherwise returns false

size

public long size()
Determines size of a file. See st_size

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns the size of the path otherwise the File method length is used. NOTE: If the item is not a file, the result is undefined
See Also:
File.length()

modified

public long modified()
Gets the modification timestamp in Java Epoch in milliseconds. Luckily, the UNIX and Java Epochs are the same. See st_mtime

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns the date of the last modification of the path otherwise the File method lastModified is used.
See Also:
File.lastModified()

accessed

public long accessed()
              throws IOException,
                     InterruptedException,
                     UnsupportedOperationException
Gets the last accessed timestamp in Java Epoch in milliseconds. Only supported if available. Luckily, the UNIX and Java Epochs are the same. See st_atime

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns the date of the last accessed of the path
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem calling stat command
InterruptedException - If there is a problem calling stat command
UnsupportedOperationException - If this system does not support the stat command

created

public long created()
             throws IOException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    UnsupportedOperationException
Gets the created timestamp in Java Epoch in milliseconds. Only supported if available. Luckily, the UNIX and Java Epochs are the same. See st_ctime

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns the created date of the path
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem calling stat command
InterruptedException - If there is a problem calling stat command
UnsupportedOperationException - If this system does not support the stat command

birthed

public long birthed()
             throws IOException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    UnsupportedOperationException
Gets the birthed timestamp in Java Epoch in milliseconds. Only supported if available. Luckily, the UNIX and Java Epochs are the same. See st_birthtime

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns the birthed date of the path
Throws:
IOException - If there is a problem calling stat command
InterruptedException - If there is a problem calling stat command
UnsupportedOperationException - If this system does not support the stat command

type

public int type()
         throws IOException,
                InterruptedException
Gets the type of the file.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns st_mode & S_IFMT otherwise returns -1
Throws:
IOException
InterruptedException

permissions

public int permissions()
                throws IOException,
                       InterruptedException
Gets the permissions of the file.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns st_mode & (S_IRWXU | S_IRWXG | S_IRWXO) otherwise returns -1
Throws:
IOException
InterruptedException

flags

public int flags()
          throws IOException,
                 InterruptedException
Gets the permissions of the file.

Returns:
If full stat support is available (and does not throw exceptions), then returns st_flags field otherwise returns -1
Throws:
IOException
InterruptedException

main

public static void main(String... args)
Test.

Parameters:
args - Files to get stat information on
